title: (x) University of South Africa - ITC Galliard, Times {Yves}
content:
Dear All   
   
The University of South Africa (UNISA) has an "interim" logo during a merger process, consisting of the (letterspaced) name of the institution. Can you identify the font used?   
   
 ![unisabw](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225152056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47722.jpg)   
   
 ![unisac](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225152056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47723.gif)   
   
Thank you   
Robert Broom

 [‹ (x) To see far is one thing - Zapfino, Brancusi {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225152056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6353 "Go to previous forum topic") [Trouble with the R ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225152056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6345 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: Top one looks like [ITC Galliard](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225152056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-galliard/roman/testdrive.html?s=UNIVERSITY%20OF%20SOUTH%20AFRICA&p=36), bottom one probably is [Times](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225152056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/times/roman/testdrive.html?s=UNIVERSITY%20OF%20SOUTH%20AFRICA&p=36).
